segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) provides the following listed set of Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) provides the following listed set of Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: Administrators can use these PowerShell cmdlets to perform various MBAM server tasks from the command prompt rather than from the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: Administrators can use these PowerShell cmdlets to perform various MBAM server tasks from the command prompt rather than from the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: How to administer MBAM by using PowerShell
segment.target: How to administer MBAM by using PowerShell

segment.source: Use the PowerShell cmdlets described here to administer MBAM.
segment.target: Use the PowerShell cmdlets described here to administer MBAM.

segment.source: Adds a new hardware model to the MBAM hardware inventory.
segment.target: Adds a new hardware model to the MBAM hardware inventory.

segment.source: This cmdlet can also specify whether the hardware is supported or unsupported for BitLocker drive encryption.
segment.target: This cmdlet can also specify whether the hardware is supported or unsupported for BitLocker drive encryption.

segment.source: Requests an MBAM recovery key that will enable a user to unlock a computer or encrypted drive.
segment.target: Requests an MBAM recovery key that will enable a user to unlock a computer or encrypted drive.

segment.source: Gets a master hardware inventory that contains data that indicates whether hardware models are compatible or incompatible with BitLocker drive encryption.
segment.target: Gets a master hardware inventory that contains data that indicates whether hardware models are compatible or incompatible with BitLocker drive encryption.

segment.source: Provides a TPM owner password for a user to manage their TPM (Trusted Platform Module) access.
segment.target: Provides a TPM owner password for a user to manage their TPM (Trusted Platform Module) access.

segment.source: Helps users when TPM has locked them out and will no longer accept their PIN.
segment.target: Helps users when TPM has locked them out and will no longer accept their PIN.

segment.source: Installs MBAM features that provide advanced group policy, encryption, key recovery, and compliance reporting tools.
segment.target: Installs MBAM features that provide advanced group policy, encryption, key recovery, and compliance reporting tools.

segment.source: Removes the hardware models from the hardware inventory.
segment.target: Removes the hardware models from the hardware inventory.

segment.source: Allows management of a master hardware inventory to designate whether or not hardware models are capable or incapable to perform BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: Allows management of a master hardware inventory to designate whether or not hardware models are capable or incapable to perform BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: Removes previously installed MBAM features that provide advanced policy, encryption, key recovery, and compliance reporting tools.
segment.target: Removes previously installed MBAM features that provide advanced policy, encryption, key recovery, and compliance reporting tools.
